prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Curved, Metallic Object Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3686, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Step 9: Transform the 2D sketch to 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 10: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D part with a depth of 0.3686 towards its normal direction. Step 11: Assign the description to the part - Shape: A three-dimensional, curved, metallic object with a smooth surface. - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.3686 - Height: 0.75 The first part of the CAD model is now complete. Continue with the subsequent parts as provided in the CAD Assembly JSON, and repeat the steps with the indicated shapes, measurements, and coordinate systems. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1, starting with a line from 0.062, 0.062 to 0.688, 0.062. Follow with a line from 0.688, 0.062 to 0.688, 0.3946. Continue with a line from 0.688, 0.3946 to 0.062, 0.3946. End the loop with a line from 0.062, 0.3946 to 0.062, 0.062. Create loop 2, starting with a line from 0.062, 0.062 to 0.688, 0.062. Follow with a line from 0.688, 0.062 to 0.688, 0.3946. Continue with a line from 0.688, 0.3946 to 0.062, 0.3946. End the loop with a line from 0.062, 0.3946 to 0.062, 0.062. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along the normal vector by 0.1957 units. Use the JoinFeatureOperation for this part. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The height of the prism is 0.1957 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the length is also 0.75 units.</description>

Step 4: Scale and Transform the 2D sketch to 3D - Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0234. - Transform the scaled 2D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D scaled and transformed sketch along the normal vector by 0.75 units. Note, since this is a new body feature operation, a new solid body will be created. Summary of Part 1: - Shape: A long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. - The part has a length of 0.0234 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0234 units. - The part is constructed using: - 6 lines with corresponding endpoints. - 1 loop connecting the lines and 1 face formed by the loop. **Note: Detailed instructions for the next parts will be provided by continuing the pattern used here, given their respective JSON definitions.**</description>

The resulting part will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, dimensions of 2 units by 3 units by 4 units, and a length, width, and height of approximately 0.75 units each.</description>
